metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5253 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
OpenStack Identity (Keystone) 2014.1.x before 2014.1.2.1 and Juno before Juno-3 does not properly revoke tokens when a domain is invalidated, which allows remote authenticated users to retain access via a domain-scoped token for that domain.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5253` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

keystone - 1:2014.1.2.1-0ubuntu1.1
python-keystone - 1:2014.1.2.1-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> Per upstream, revocation events added in Icehouse (Ubuntu 14.04 LTS)

criterions.comment: keystone package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2014.1.2.1-0ubuntu1.1').
